Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that excavations to expose the underground fault for repairs is taking longer than expected.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 16:30-17:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Decasta at 13:25.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 13:04 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information. Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers. Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Danescroft Drive SS9 4 area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Decasta at 12:47.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's Decasta from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.

We know power may have been off for a long time; we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused.  

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again today. We believed all power was restored but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue which is causing our substation equipment to operate repeatedly.

Our engineers are still on site and we are now estimating to restore power between 16:00-17:00. Sent by Decasta at 13:02.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 11:59 - We can now confirm that all power in the HP19 8 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by Emergency Isolation affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 09-DEC-2025 18:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 11:39 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have let us know that they have isolated power following reports of a grounded overhead cable. They have investigated the grounded cable, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all but 2 properties in the IP10 0 and IP11 0 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 12:45 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 36 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 22 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the SG8 0/5 area to investigate the power cut affecting 58 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Kevin at 12:37.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We're currently estimating power will be on between 13:30-14:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 10:30 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Fox Road HP15 6 area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Decasta at 09:24
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Fox Road HP15 6 area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame to restore power is between 11:30-12:30, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Decasta at 08:56.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near South Street.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 00:46 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Womersley Road area, the estimated time of 02:30 and 03:30 hasn't changed. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 01:12 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1940 customers in the Northwood, HA6 2 area, by diverting power around the underground fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Luke at 00:36 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is underground fault that initially interrupted power to 1940 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 385 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 02:00 and 03:00 but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Luke at 01:12 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1940 customers in the Northwood, HA6 2 area, by diverting power around the underground fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

Sent by Luke at 00:36 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is underground fault that initially interrupted power to 1940 properties.

However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 385 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment.

We're currently estimating power will be on between 02:00 and 03:00 but this may change depending on what our staff find.

Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.

What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  Our engineers have attended the fault, and have made an emergency repair to restore power to as many premises as possible.  It is our intention to return to make a permanent repair as soon as we can.  I'm sorry, but we can't give you a time for this at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 09:57 - We can now confirm that all power in the Roxeth Green Avenue HA2 8 area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 09:50- Just to let you know our staff have now arrived back on site in the Roxeth Green Avenue HA2 8 area. They are going to test our equipment thoroughly to check if the underlying issue can be located before they attempt to restore your power again.

I know having power cuts this often must be causing you a lot of problems, and our staff are doing everything they can to keep the power on. Our estimated time frame is currently between 11:00-12:00, although as we mentioned previously this can be subject to change.

We're keeping in touch with our staff regularly to make sure you have the best information to plan ahead. I'll update you as soon as we hear more from them.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 09:12 - We're sorry your power has gone off again today. Our engineers investigated the fault earlier but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue which is causing our substation equipment to operate repeatedly.

Our engineers will be back on site as quickly as possible and our estimated time frame of 11:00-12:00 hasn't changed. We'll keep you updated with all of our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine transformers on our electricity poles to check they are functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future as we appreciate you may have been impacted by an unplanned power cut in the last 6 months. This work is taking place in the Little Green area.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 07:48 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the RM3 9 area should now be back on.

I'm sorry for the continued disruption recently. We believe there may be a fault on our underground electricity cabling in the area, but currently it has not developed to a stage that our staff can pinpoint it. Their tests have proven inconclusive, so for now they have replaced our safety equipment at the substation to get your power back on as quickly as possible.

This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. We want to be as transparent as possible as we know having multiple power cuts is disruptive and worrying, so I would like to help explain why we can't always fix a problem like this right away.

Underground electricity cabling is insulated for safety and if a fault develops, these materials can re-seal due to heat passing through them when our safety equipment operates and your power is lost. This covers any potential fault again, meaning our staff cannot locate it using their tests or specialist equipment.

We'll know more once our staff contact us again, so I'll be in touch again shortly.

Sent by Decasta at 07:35.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the RM3 9 area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to be testing if the network is still healthy.

They will start at the substation, and often apply specialist equipment that may turn your power back on for a brief period, so don't worry if your power comes on and goes off again. They will also check smaller sites which run along our cabling route, these break our network down into smaller sections and can help pinpoint any possible problems.

Our estimated time frame to restore power is between 10:00-11:00. I'll let you know more once our staff update us. Sent by Decasta at 07:22.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We were investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which caused a power cut in the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Lisa at 11:13 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 129 customers in the Battle TN33 9  area to safely remove a tree from our overhead line.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Lisa at 10:54 -

We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu
 
If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Engineers have arrived on site in the Battle TN33 9  area to investigate the tree on our overhead line. 

Using an average timescale for this type of issue we're looking to have you back on between 12:00 and 13:00, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We'll continue to update you with all of our progress.

Sent by Lisa at 09:44.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needed replacing and upgrading. To ensure our engineers can transfer the cables to the new transformer which has been installed we will need to temporarily switch off your power. Doing this will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Courtmead Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine 3 transformers on our electricity poles to check they are functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near School Road and Top Road.

Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place on land off Stony Lane.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We are upgrading a piece of equipment called a transformer, following a customer request for a larger electricity supply. Once complete this work will adhere to the customer request as we have a duty to provide electricity when requested. This will also ensure our network can uphold the increased electricity usage in your area. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off and upgrade the transformer. We will remove the existing one and install a new one on the same day. Please note there will be a road closure in place on the day to allow the works to be completed safely but access will always be provided. This work is taking place in the Wrayfields area.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 13:38 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 40 customers in the Eastbourne Road area for safety so they could carry out overhead network repairs and remove a temporary generator.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lisa at 13:26 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 12:33 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Eastbourne Road area for safety so they can carry out overhead network repairs and remove a temporary generator. Our estimated time to have your power back on is between 13:00 and 14:00, however, this may need to change later depending on how our works progress. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Handcross Road. Two way traffic lights will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 09:01 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Back Street area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cabling fault. Engineers have partially repaired the fault but further work will be carried out. As the power has now been restored, the customer support vehicle has been cancelled.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lisa at 08:22 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Just to let you know we're sending our customer support vehicle out to your area.

This can provide hot water, some hot food (or a microwave to heat your own), WIFI, charging points and on site information. We'll let you know once it arrives. Sent by Lisa at 07:36.

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Boundary Road area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 09:30 and 10:30; this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Our staff have now arrived on site in the Boundary Road area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 09:30 and 10:30; this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If this happens we'll need to arrange further teams and equipment, so I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us. Sent by Bev at 06:58.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 05:00 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 65 customers in the Norwich, NR16 2 area, by by diverting power around the overhead fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Norwich, NR16 2 area to investigate the power cut affecting 65 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Luke at 04:50.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 03:14. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place Upper Bourne End Lane.

This work is taking place in Wingate Hill.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 02:57 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 86 customers in the March, PE15 9 area, by diverting power around the overhead fault. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, so we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the March, PE15 9 area to investigate the power cut affecting 86 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Luke at 02:18.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Luke from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I'm sorry for the power cut today; I know the lights going off can be disruptive.

We know that some customers affected by todays power cut may have had other issues recently, and I appreciate this is frustrating. High voltage cabling can cover a wide area, so sometimes properties very close to you may have had power cuts that you didn't experience.

I know you may not have had any previous power cuts, but if you have, we often get progress updates from our field staff management about investigations into repeat issues, and our Customer Services team will try to contact everyone affected by them to explain what's happening.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate you may have been impacted by unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place in the Stable Lane area.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power for a long time can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Kevin, Bev, Lisa, Aaron and Decasta are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

Our relief engineers have now arrived on site to compete underground network repairs. As soon as an estimated time frame to restore power is provided, I'll be in touch.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again. Sent by Decasta at 06:45
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 05:08 - I'm very sorry you're still without power.

Our engineers have been working hard to get you back on, but due to their shift ending we now need to send out a relief team first thing in the morning. This means that you may not receive any texts for a while.
